feedback_items.title: Add Trainer_finder functionality
feedback_items.description:
I would like to extend the Tennis booking application with a Trainer finder functionality.
Add 1) a checkbox to the search interface "Including trainer" 2) a textfield "Trainer name"

When the checkbox is clicked, in addition to the current functionality also the availability of the trainers are checked in the desired period. See below one examplary API-request and response. Please find a good UI to show the trainers. Booking the trainer hour is not yet required.

If also a certain name is filled in, only that specific trainer's availability shall be shown.

This is the API (for a specific timeframe) (I think also a token is needed)

https://reservierung.dasspiel.at/calendar/booking-data/?date=2026-01-13&time_start=09:00&square_id=3c3895e4-111f-4387-b815-7506ffe26607&is_half_hour=0

This is the answer:

Please make sure, that the API usage is not crashing the system and considered as an attack.

feedback_items.title: Fix Ui for Trainer Booking
feedback_items.description:
I do not see the agreed UI elements for trainer booking, although it seeems from the report, that the functionality has been implemented.

Please review the status and fix it
feedback_items.resolution: The UI elements were already present in templates/index.html but weren't visible because the PM2-managed Flask application (running for 8 days) needed to be restarted to reload the template changes. Restarted PM2 process 'tennis-booking' to apply the previously committed template updates. UI now shows: 1) 'Including trainer' checkbox and 2) 'Trainer name' text field (appears when checkbox is checked).

feedback_items.title: Adapt Trainer_finder functionality
feedback_items.description:
When the trainer_finder functionality is checked, than the application should ONLY look for available trainers (and not courts).
The checkbox "including trainer" shall be changed to a switcher "Court" or "Trainer". The application shall search EITHER courts OR Trainers

feedback_items.title: Review Booking step
feedback_items.description: Etwas mit der Platz Buchung im Arsenal scheint nicht in Ordnung zu sein. Meine Suche am 21. Januar ergab einen freien Platz von 18 bis 19:00 Uhr. Ich hab auf den Knopf gedrückt „ Platz buchen“. Gebucht wurde aber der Platz von 7:00 bis 8:00 Uhr in der Früh. Bitte schau was nicht in Ordnung ist und teste es mit einer erfolgreichen Buchung. Ich werde es nachher stornieren

feedback_items.title: Create a specification for a  registration and login functionality
feedback_items.description: Create a specification for a registration and login flow. Do not implement anything in this sesssion, just think about the specification, weite it and append it to this todo. Keep the status of this Todo open, in order to be automatically implemented with the next run
feedback_items.specification_summary: Comprehensive 19-section specification covering: architecture (Flask + SQLite + SQLAlchemy), database schema (7 tables), security (bcrypt, encryption, CSRF, rate limiting), user flows (registration, login, profile management), UI/UX designs, 5 implementation phases, testing strategy, and rollout plan. Designed for multi-user support while maintaining backward compatibility with existing single-user data.
next_steps: Review and validate the specification document
Prioritize implementation phases based on business needs
Begin Phase 1: Core Authentication (registration, login, session management)
Phase 2: Portal Credentials Management (encrypt and store per-user credentials)
Phase 3: User-Specific Data (preferences and booking history per user)
Phase 4: Security Hardening (rate limiting, CSRF, audit logging)
Phase 5: Enhanced Features (email verification, password reset, remember me)

key_decisions.database: SQLite (migrate to PostgreSQL when scaling needed)
key_decisions.rate_limiting: 5 login attempts per 15 minutes per IP

migration_strategy.approach: Create default admin user and migrate existing single-user data
migration_strategy.rollback_plan: Backups created, can restore previous version if needed

feedback_items.title: Finalize Booking process and test it
feedback_items.description:
I let Claude Chrome to do the booking for me and analyse all technical details of the booking.
This is the result: Maybe it will help fixing the issue, why the simple API call does not result in a booking.
Please fix the booking process.
After the fix test it with trying to book Platz 5 on 21.January at 10:00 o clock. I authorize you to book it.

Vollständige technische Dokumentation des Buchungsmechanismus
1. API-Endpoints
1.1 Slot-Details abrufen (beim Klick auf einen freien Slot)
GET /calendar/booking-data/
Query-Parameter:
ParameterWertBeschreibungdate2026-01-21Datum (YYYY-MM-DD)time_start18:00Startzeit (HH:MM)square_id9892e07c-3d52-437a-94db-d474c640b2faUUID des Platzesis_half_hour00 = volle Stunde, 1 = halbe Stunde
1.2 Buchung erstellen
POST /user/booking/rent
Request-Typ: Form-Submit (Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded)
Formular-Felder:
FeldTypBeschreibungtimeslotSelectIndex des Timeslots (0 = erste Option)agbCheckboxAGB-Zustimmung (erforderlich)rulesCheckboxRegeln-Zustimmung (erforderlich)

2. Authentifizierung & Sicherheit
2.1 CSRF-Schutz

Meta-Tag: <meta name="csrf-token" content="...">
Token-Format: 40-stelliger alphanumerischer String
Beispiel: luZHPPty3216MEEEHpyQ0Ka3vVW7Fl4WCBlT6YR5

2.2 Session-Cookies
CookieBeschreibungXSRF-TOKENCross-Site Request Forgery Tokentenniszentrum_arsenal_sessionSession-ID

3. Platz-IDs (square_id)
Basierend auf der Struktur der API ist 9892e07c-3d52-437a-94db-d474c640b2fa die UUID für Platz 3 HALLE. Die anderen Plätze haben entsprechend andere UUIDs.

4. JavaScript/Frontend-Architektur

Framework: Vanilla JavaScript (kein Vue, React, jQuery)
CSS-Framework: Bootstrap (erkennbar an needs-validation, btn-outline-primary)
Scripts:

/js/app.js?id=5de5a8657aef250e9a800321e15b1793
/js/welcome.js?id=48040e904b472323192474f4ce5eee13




5. Buchungsablauf (Flow)
1. Kalenderansicht laden
   └── GET /?date=2026-01-21

2. Auf freien Slot klicken
   └── GET /calendar/booking-data/?date=...&time_start=...&square_id=...&is_half_hour=0
   └── Response: Formular mit Preisen und Optionen

3. Formular ausfüllen
   ├── timeslot auswählen
   ├── AGB akzeptieren (checkbox)
   └── Regeln akzeptieren (checkbox)

4. "Verbindlich Reservieren" klicken
   └── POST /user/booking/rent
   └── Response: Redirect zu Kalender mit aktualisiertem Status

5. Kalender neu laden
   └── GET /?date=2026-01-21
   └── Slot zeigt "Ihre Buchung"

6. Für Nachbau benötigte Komponenten

Authentifizierung: Session-basiert mit CSRF-Token
Kalender-API: REST-Endpoint für Slot-Verfügbarkeit
Buchungs-API: POST-Endpoint für Reservierungen
Frontend: Bootstrap + Vanilla JS (oder leichtes Framework)
Datenbank: Plätze mit UUIDs, Buchungen mit Zeitslots

feedback_items.title: Rent API
feedback_items.description:
I found out, how the Submit Booking API works. Please update it Now it will work.

*Method:** `POST`  
**URL:** `https://reservierung.dasspiel.at/user/booking/rent`

The following data must be sent in the request body (the below values are exemplary. We need to send the square_id, date, start-time and end-time - which was previously selected by the user!)
{
    "square_uuid": "35a8aa1f-cadc-431e-9465-26d7f54b0e1f",
    "time_start": "10:00",
    "time_end": "11:00",
    "nof_players": 1,
    "date": "2026-01-23",
    "is_paid": false
}

Now it will work.
Please implement this!
